text: LeRoy Walter Lemke (September 24, 1935 - September 19, 1991) was an American politician and lawyer. Lemke was born in Chicago, Illinois. He graduated from Drake University and John Marshall Law School. He was admitted to the Illinois bar and practice law in Chicago. Lemke served in the Illinois House of Representatives from 1973 to 1975 and was a Democrat. Lemke then served in the Illinois Senate from 1975 to 1987. Lemke died at the La Grange Memorial Hospital in La Grange, Illinois. He had lived in Willow Springs, Illinois at the time of his death.Illinois Blue Book 1985-1986,' Biographical Sketch of LeRoy Waler Lemke, pg. 87'Leroy Lemke; Served 14 Years In State Senate,' The Chicago Tribune, September 20, 1991 ==Notes== Category:1935 births Category:1991 deaths Category:Lawyers from Chicago Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Drake University alumni Category:John Marshall Law School (Chicago) alumni Category:Illinois Democrats Category:Members of the Illinois House of Representatives Category:Illinois state senators Category:20th- century American politicians
title: LeRoy Lemke
